channel.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I'm sort of new to coding, however i want to take it as a career so i thought it would be a good idea to start it. Anyway, I have been trying to make my client a .Jar for days, I have watched 100s of tutorials with no luck. I am running a Project Insanity 317 Client and source.
Client Run.Bat: @echo off Title SiriousScape Client - Running... Java -Xmx1024m -cp bin; Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause
If anyone could help me out I would really appreciate it, thanks!

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Sirious Sirious
item.description:
@Sirious wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

Try putting the output directory to where it loads all your .classfiles for a 317s the manifest is set at client. You could delete all the .classfiles leaving only the javafiles then recompile and try to jar again

Didn’t work, thanks for the reply though, any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Try putting the output directory to where it loads all your .classfiles for a 317s the manifest is set at client. You could delete all the .classfiles leaving only the javafiles then recompile and try to jar again

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Sirious Sirious
item.description:
@Sirious wrote:

Still not fixed, although this error might help: “Could not load or find main class: client” this also happened when we put “Client” “Jframe” and “jframe” in manifest template. Any ideas? PI 317 client

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

I deleted your message from earlier sorry what did you say was the issue lol

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

[quote=“KempiScape, post:10, topic:528027”]If you really want to make a career out of programming here are some tips,

program what you like to program, this way you will learn much quicker
use google when you need something (trust me this will teach you as well)
and use your own way of learning, your own pace. Good luck[/quote]

I’m also trying to pursue programming as a career. Thank you for the tip! I love learning to program on RuneScape private servers. It’s fun for my friends too.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape

and use your own way of learning, your own pace. Good luck

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Sirious Sirious
item.description:
@Sirious wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:5, topic:528027”][quote author=Pk6uhave2 link=topic=646775.msg4349680#msg4349680 date=1376445086]
I’m not saying this to be a jack ass or anything, but if you can’t jar/sign a client then I suggest not making it a career.

You need Jar Maker. Your run.bat has nothing to do with this.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/tutorials/466541-noob-friendly-how-jar-sign-your-rsps-client-noob-friendly.html
[/quote]No one should be making a career out of creating RSPS.[/quote]

I mean programming

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:7, topic:528027”]I made a jarring tutorial a while back. If you search for jarring tutorial moparscape loveandpower it should come up on google.

edit: here you go

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Thank you very much! I’ll give it a try

jamesiscool12345678910:

I’ll help, got tv?

Ill try Java-RSPS-Noob’s tutorial, if that doesn’t work, ill edit this. No I don’t have team viewer, I will get it though (:

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:5, topic:528027”][quote author=Pk6uhave2 link=topic=646775.msg4349680#msg4349680 date=1376445086]
I’m not saying this to be a jack ass or anything, but if you can’t jar/sign a client then I suggest not making it a career.

You need Jar Maker. Your run.bat has nothing to do with this.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/tutorials/466541-noob-friendly-how-jar-sign-your-rsps-client-noob-friendly.html
[/quote]No one should be making a career out of creating RSPS.[/quote]

He’s talking about making a career out of programming. Java is a programming language. RuneScape private servers are programmed with Java. It’s a start, and everyone has to start somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Client.jar help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Sirious Sirious
item.description:
@Sirious wrote:

Thank you for your reply, everyone starts somewhere don’t they? I have JAR maker, I can jar it, but i get ‘could not load or find main class’ error when i try and run it, I have tried putting ‘client’ and ‘Jframe’ into manifest template with now luck, any ideas?

I have also tried that tutorial with no luck, my client is 317 if that helps in anyway?

Read full topic

Hello everyone, I’m sort of new to coding, however i want to take it as a career so i thought it would be a good idea to start it. Anyway, I have been trying to make my client a .Jar for days, I have watched 100s of tutorials with no luck. I am running a Project Insanity 317 Client and source.
